bullets: • The first legitimately brilliant sharksploitation movie in almost a decade
• Keeper is vintage Oz Perkins, for better and worse
• The predominantly forest-set visuals are stunning, evoking folk horror without belaboring the point
• It’s badly paced with several major lulls where the tension dissipates completely

items.title: New Year’s Eve Horror Marathon Schedule
bullets: • This marathon is designed to mirror the emotional arc of New Year’s Eve itself
• It starts light and communal, escalating into chaos, and ends in quiet reflection
• The Invitation (2015) slides in seamlessly as the night quiets down
• End of Days leans fully into turn-of-the-century fear, religious horror, and looming catastrophe

items.title: ‘It changes lives’: the sporting event for organ transplant recipients
bullets: • Jenny Glithero received an emergency liver transplant after contracting a viral infection
• She had to learn how to breathe before she could even start walking again
• While in hospital, a doctor told her about the transplant games and she decided to compete
• The British Transplant Games is a national sporting event for organ transplant recipients

items.title: Everything you need to know about Biden's student loan forgiveness program

• A decision is expected by late June or early July

items.title: Horror Legend Hart D. Fisher Acquires Iconic Roku Channel B-Movie TV
bullets: • Horror Legend Hart D
• Fisher acquires B-Movie TV, the long-running 24/7 linear streaming destination for cult cinema on the Roku platform
• Fisher takes the helm from founder Ken “Ace” Brewer, ensuring the survival of one of the longest-operating independent channels in the streaming era
• The channel is renowned for its unique curation, blending full-length features with retro “racy” commercials, trailers, and interstitial content

items.title: Did you know that Gmail has emoji reactions?
bullets: • Google is bringing emoji reactions to all Workspace users by default on February 9th
• The feature is hidden within a small, smiley face icon beside the Forward button
• If your recipient is another Gmail user, they’ll see your reaction at the bottom of the email, as well as see the emoji as an update to the thread
